CUP OF TEA.Definition: something you enjoy or you are interested in

BRUTALLY.Definition: in a cruel and violent manner

FUGITIVE.Definition: a person who was trying to avoid capture by authorities

ON THE RUN.Definition: trying to avoid capture by authorities

PROSECUTED.Definition: charged with a crime and brought to trial

LOADED.Definition: armed with ammunition, ready to fire

SUBURB.Definition: area on the edge of the city

SPILLED.Definition: flowed out or poured out messily

JURY.Definition: group of people selected to make a legal decision

KNIFE-WIELDING.Definition: holding or using a knife as a weapon

REHEARSALS.Definition: practice sessions for a performance or event

PAWS.Definition: the feet of the animal with claws and pads

ALIBI.Definition: excuse or explanation for his position

SHADOWY.Definition: dark and not clear in appearance

OVERSLEPT.Definition: slept longer than intended or desired

LIMO.Definition: short form for "limousine," a luxury car

BOOT.Definition: the enclosed space at the back of a car, trunk

TESTIFY.Definition: give evidence as a witness in court

TIMING.Definition: the specific duration of the event

CIRCUMSTANTIAL.Definition: based on circumstances or indirect evidence

LEATHER.Definition: material made from the skin of animals

FOOTPRINTS.Definition: marks left by a person's foot on the ground

MATCH.Definition: evidence relating or corresponding to him

FOOTPRINT.Definition: impression or mark left by a person's foot

CIRCUMSTANCES.Definition: conditions or situation surrounding the event

WRAP UP.Definition: give a summary or review of it

CONTAMINATED.Definition: introduced to the crime scene after the crime was committed

IN A BID TO.Definition: with the intention or purpose of

SLURS.Definition: offensive or derogatory words or remarks

TENSIONS.Definition: states of hostility or opposition between people

INHERENT.Definition: existing as a natural and essential quality

VERDICT.Definition: the decision reached by the jury

DRAGGED THROUGH THE MUD.Definition: subjected to or put through public humiliation or criticism

COMPLEX.Definition: complicated, consisting of many different and connected parts

INHERENTLY.Definition: in a natural and essential manner
